 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָה‎</span>, rarely <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָהֿ‎</span> (e.g. [[Gen.31.43|Gen 31:43]]; [[Josh.22.16|Josh 22:16]]; [[Judg.8.1|Judg 8:1]]), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהֿ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהּ ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֶה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַּ ‎</span> ( [[Exod.4.2|Exod 4:2]]; [[Isa.3.15|Isa 3:15]]; [[Mal.1.13|Mal 1:13]]; [[1Chr.15.13|1Chr 15:13]]; [[2Chr.30.3|2Chr 30:3]]), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָ‎</span> (only in <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָהֵם‎</span> [[Ezek.8.6|Ezek 8:6]] [[BDB#Kt|Kt]]., [[BDB#Qr|Qr]]. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָה הֵם‎</span>) — on the distinction in the use of these forms, see [[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:37»§ 37</sup> — 

**pronoun interrogative** and **indefinite** ==what? how? aught==; used of things, as <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִי‎</span> of persons (Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָא‎</span>, Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; probably apocope from a longer form with ***n*** or ***nt***, Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***minû***</u></abbr> ([[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 417 f.</sup>), Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***ment***; compare [[BDB#W|W]]<sup>CG 123 ff.</sup> K?:ii. 368): — 

**1.** interrogative ***what ?*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** in a direct question, before either verbs or nouns [[Gen.4.10|Gen 4:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֶה עשׂית‎</span> ***what*** hast thou done ? [[Gen.15.2|Gen 15:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מהתֿתןלֿי‎</span> ***what*** wilt thou give me ? [[Exod.3.13|Exod 3:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהשְּֿׁמוֺ‎</span>, [[Exod.12.26|Exod 12:26]]; [[Exod.13.14|Exod 13:14]] and so very often: <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַההִֿיא‎</span> [[Zech.5.6|Zech 5:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה אלה‎</span> [[Zech.1.9|Zech 1:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָה אַתָּה רֹאֶה‎</span> [[Jer.1.11|Jer 1:11]]; [[Amos.7.8|Amos 7:8]] +; Jl [[Amos.4.14|Amos 4:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה אתם לי‎</span>; [[Judg.18.8|Judg 18:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה אתם‎</span> see Commentaries, v[[Judg.18.24|Judg 18:24]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה לי עוד‎</span> ***what*** have I still ? [[Isa.21.11|Isa 21:11]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מהמֿלילה‎</span> ***what*** (= how much) of the night (is past) ? = ***as what ?*** (***qualem ?***) [[Hag.2.3|Hag 2:3]] (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִי‎</span> [[Amos.7.2|Amos 7:2]]); to express surprise, [[Job.9.12|Job 9:12]] who shall say to him, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה תעשׂה‎</span> ***what*** doest thou ? [[Job.22.13|Job 22:13]]; [[Eccl.8.4|Eccl 8:4]]; [[Isa.45.9|Isa 45:9]]; [[Isa.45.10|Isa 45:10]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּי‎</span>, [[Gen.20.10|Gen 20:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה ראית כי עשׂית‎</span> ***what*** hadst thou in view, that thou hast done, etc.? [[Gen.31.36|Gen 31:36]]; [[Exod.16.7|Exod 16:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְנַחְנוּ מָה כִּי‎</span> and ***what*** are we, that . . .? [[Exod.32.21|Exod 32:21]]; [[Num.22.28|Num 22:28]]; [[Hab.2.18|Hab 2:18]], etc. Note in particular — 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***a***) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָה‎</span> is followed sometimes by a substantive in apposition (against Arabic usage, which does not permit this: [[BDB#W|W]]<sup>AG. ii. § 170</sup>), so that it becomes virtually an adjective: <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהבֶּֿצַע‎</span> ***what*** profit . . .? [[Gen.37.26|Gen 37:26]]; [[Ps.30.10|Ps 30:10]]; [[Mal.3.14|Mal 3:14]]; [[Isa.40.8|Isa 40:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהדְּֿמוּת‎</span>, [[Mal.1.13|Mal 1:13]]; [[Ps.89.48|Ps 89:48]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זְכָראֲֿנִי מֶה חָ֑לֶד‎</span> (inverted for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֶלֶד אָ֑נִי מַה‎</span>) remember (of) ***what*** (short) duration I am, [[Eccl.1.3|Eccl 1:3]]; [[Eccl.5.10|Eccl 5:10]]; [[Eccl.5.15|Eccl 5:15]]; [[Eccl.6.8|Eccl 6:8]]; [[Eccl.6.11|Eccl 6:11]] ([[BDB#Da|Da]]<sup>§ 8, R. 2 K?:iii. 23 f.</sup>); as exclamation, [[Ps.89.48|Ps 89:48]]b [[Job.26.14|Job 26:14]]. And with the substantive idiomatically at the end (in Arabic preceded then by <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">: [[BDB#W|W]]<sup>AG. ii. § 49. 7</sup>), [[1Sam.26.18|1Sam 26:18]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ומַהבֿידי רעה‎</span> and what is there in my hand, evil ? [[1Sam.20.10|1Sam 20:10]] (see **3**), [[2Sam.19.29|2Sam 19:29]]; [[2Sam.24.13|2Sam 24:13]]; [[2Sam.1.16|2Sam 1:16]];  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מהמֿצאו אבותיכם בי עָוֶל‎</span>, [[Eccl.11.2|Eccl 11:2]]; [[Esth.6.3|Esth 6:3]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***b***) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהזֶּֿה‎</span> ***what now ?*** [[1Sam.10.11|1Sam 10:11]], contracted <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַזֶּה‎</span> [[Exod.4.2|Exod 4:2]] (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה‎</span> **4 c**); [[Gen.3.13|Gen 3:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהזּֿאֹת עָשִׂיתָ‎</span>; [[Gen.12.18|Gen 12:18]]; [[Gen.29.25|Gen 29:25]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהזּֿאֹת עָשִׂיתָה לִּי‎</span>; similarly [[Gen.26.10|Gen 26:10]]; [[Gen.42.28|Gen 42:28]] +, either ***what, now***, hast thou done ? or ***what is this*** that thou hast done ? (see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה‎</span> **4 d**). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***c***) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְּךָ מַהֿ‎</span> ***what*** to thee ? i.e. ***what aileth*** thee ? or ***what dost thou want ?*** [[Gen.21.17|Gen 21:17]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהלָּֿךְ הָגָר‎</span>; [[Josh.15.18|Josh 15:18]]; [[2Sam.14.5|2Sam 14:5]]; [[1Kgs.1.16|1Kgs 1:16]]; [[2Kgs.6.28|2Kgs 6:28]]; [[Ezek.18.2|Ezek 18:2]] (accents); followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּי‎</span>, [[Judg.18.23|Judg 18:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מהלֿך כי נזעקת‎</span>, [[Gen.20.9|Gen 20:9]] (compare [[1Sam.11.5|1Sam 11:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לעם כי יבכו מה‎</span>), [[Isa.22.1|Isa 22:1]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהלָּֿךְ כִּי עָלִיתְ‎</span> (compare <span class="bdbLangGreek">τί παθὼν</span>, <span class="bdbLangGreek">τοῦτο ποιεῖς</span>;), [[Ps.114.5|Ps 114:5]] without <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּי‎</span> [[Isa.3.15|Isa 3:15]] (compare Qor 57:8; 57:10); with a participle, [[Jonah.1.6|Jonah 1:6]] ***what is it to thee*** as a sleeper ? (accusative: [[BDB#Da|Da]]<sup>§ 70 a</sup> cites Qor 74:50), [[Ezek.18.2|Ezek 18:2]] (if <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אתם‎</span> be treated as strengthening <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לכם‎</span>). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***d***) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פֹה‎</span> (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִי‎</span>) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהלְּֿךָ‎</span> = ***what*** hast thou (have I) here ? [[Judg.18.3|Judg 18:3]]; [[1Kgs.19.9|1Kgs 19:9]]; [[Isa.22.16|Isa 22:16]]; [[Isa.52.5|Isa 52:5]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***e***) in the genitive, [[Jer.8.9|Jer 8:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְחָכְמַתמֶֿה לָהֶם‎</span>, and wisdom of ***what*** (= what kind of wisdom) is theirs ? [[Num.23.3|Num 23:3]] (see below **3**). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** often in an ***indirect*** question, as after <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ראה‎</span>, [[Gen.2.19|Gen 2:19]] to see <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מהיֿקראלֿו‎</span> ***what*** he would call it, [[Gen.37.20|Gen 37:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְנִרְאֶה מהיֿהיו חלֹמֹתיו‎</span> ***to what*** his dreams will come, [[Num.13.19|Num 13:19]]f.; [[Hab.2.1|Hab 2:1]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִכִּיר‎</span> [[Gen.31.32|Gen 31:32]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ידע‎</span> [[Gen.39.8|Gen 39:8]]; [[Exod.2.4|Exod 2:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לדעת מהיֵּֿעָשֶׂה לו‎</span>, [[Exod.16.15|Exod 16:15]]; [[Exod.32.1|Exod 32:1]]; [[Job.34.4|Job 34:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁמע‎</span> [[Num.9.8|Num 9:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְאשׁמעה מהיֿצוה י‎</span> (compare [[Ps.85.9|Ps 85:9]]), [[2Sam.17.5|2Sam 17:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פֹּרַשׁ‎</span> [[Num.15.34|Num 15:34]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁאל‎</span> [[1Kgs.3.5|1Kgs 3:5]]; [[2Kgs.2.9|2Kgs 2:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֵבִין‎</span> [[Job.6.24|Job 6:24]]; [[Job.23.5|Job 23:5]]: [[Num.13.18|Num 13:18]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה היא וראיתם את הארץ‎</span>, [[Ps.39.5|Ps 39:5]]; [[Isa.41.22|Isa 41:22]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הראשׁנות מָה הֵנָּה הַגִּידוּ‎</span>. — In some such cases it approximates in meaning to the simple rel., as [[Jer.7.17|Jer 7:17]]; [[Jer.33.24|Jer 33:24]]; [[Mic.6.5|Mic 6:5]]; [[Mic.6.8|Mic 6:8]]; [[Job.34.33|Job 34:33]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** = ***of what kind ?*** (German ***was für ein ... ?***), with an insinuation of blame, or reproach, or contempt: [[Gen.37.10|Gen 37:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה החלום הזה‎</span> ***what*** is this dream which thou hast dreamt? [[Gen.44.15|Gen 44:15]]; [[Josh.22.16|Josh 22:16]]; [[Judg.8.1|Judg 8:1]]; [[Judg.15.11|Judg 15:11]]; [[Judg.20.12|Judg 20:12]]; [[1Sam.29.3|1Sam 29:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָה הָעִבְרִים האלה‎</span>, [[1Kgs.9.13|1Kgs 9:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה העדים האלה אשׁר נתתה לי‎</span>, [[2Kgs.9.22|2Kgs 9:22]]; [[2Kgs.18.19|2Kgs 18:19]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה‎</span> is often used in questions to which the answer ***little***, or ***nothing***, is expected, and it thus becomes equivalent to a ***rhetorical negative*** (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲ‎</span> **b**, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִי‎</span> **f** ***c***): 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***a***) [[Gen.23.15|Gen 23:15]] land worth 400 shekels..., <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה היא‎</span> ***what is it ?*** (i.e. it is something quite insignificant), [[Gen.27.37|Gen 27:37]]; [[Judg.8.3|Judg 8:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עשׂות ככם ומהיֿכלתי‎</span>, [[Judg.14.18|Judg 14:18]]; [[Hos.9.5|Hos 9:5]]; [[Hos.10.3|Hos 10:3]]; [[Ps.30.10|Ps 30:10]]; [[Ps.56.5|Ps 56:5]]; [[Job.15.9|Job 15:9]]; [[Job.16.6|Job 16:6]]; [[Job.21.21|Job 21:21]]; [[Job.22.13|Job 22:13]]; [[Job.22.17|Job 22:17]]; [[Lam.2.13|Lam 2:13]]; [[Song.5.9|Song 5:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהאדּוֺדֵךְ מִדּוֺד‎</span> ***what*** is thy beloved (more) than a(nother) beloved ? \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לא‎</span>, [[1Kgs.12.16|1Kgs 12:16]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהלָּֿנוּ חֵלֶק בְּדָוֺד וְלֹאנַֿחֲלָה בְּבֶן יִשַׁי‎</span> ([[2Sam.20.1|2Sam 20:1]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵיןלָֿנוּ חֵלֶק וג‎</span>), [[Job.16.6|Job 16:6]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***b***) followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּי‎</span> (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּי‎</span> **1 f**), [[Gen.20.9|Gen 20:9]]; [[Gen.37.26|Gen 37:26]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהבֶּֿצַע כִּי נַהֲרֹג‎</span> ***what*** profit (is it) that we should slay him ? [[Exod.16.7|Exod 16:7]]; [[Num.16.11|Num 16:11]]; [[Hab.2.18|Hab 2:18]]; [[2Kgs.8.13|2Kgs 8:13]] ***what*** is thy servant, the dog, ***that he should do***, etc.? and often in poetry, as [[Ps.8.5|Ps 8:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָה אנושׁ כי תזכרנו‎</span> ***what*** is man ***that*** thou rememberest him ? [[Job.6.11|Job 6:11]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהכֹּֿחִי כִּי אֲיַחֵל‎</span>, v[[Job.6.11|Job 6:11]] b [[Job.7.17|Job 7:17]]; [[Job.15.12|Job 15:12]]f; [[Job.15.14|Job 15:14]]; [[Job.16.3|Job 16:3]]; [[Job.21.15|Job 21:15]] + (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִ‎</span> **f** ***b***). Hence, 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***c***) in the formula of repudiation, or emphatic denial, (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְלָכֶם‎</span>) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהלִּֿי וָלָךְ‎</span> ***what*** is there (common) to me and to thee ? i.e. what have I to do with thee ? [[Judg.11.12|Judg 11:12]]; [[2Sam.16.10|2Sam 16:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה לי ולכם‎</span>, [[2Sam.19.23|2Sam 19:23]]; [[1Kgs.17.18|1Kgs 17:18]]; [[2Kgs.3.13|2Kgs 3:13]]; [[2Chr.35.21|2Chr 35:21]] compare [[Josh.22.24|Josh 22:24]]; [[2Kgs.9.18|2Kgs 9:18]]; [[2Kgs.9.19|2Kgs 9:19]] rather differently, without <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְ‎</span>, [[Jer.2.18|Jer 2:18]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה לך לדרך מ‎</span> ***what*** is there to thee ***with reference to*** the way to Egypt ? [[Hos.14.9|Hos 14:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהאלּוֺ לַעֲצַבִּים‎</span>, compare [[Ps.50.16|Ps 50:16]] (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְסַפֵּר‎</span>); with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎את‎</span>, [[Jer.23.28|Jer 23:28]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהלַֿתֶּבֶן אֶתהַֿבָּר‎</span> ***beside*** (or ***in comparison with***) the wheat ? compare <span class="bdbLangGreek">τί ἐμοὶ</span>(<span class="bdbLangGreek">ἡμῖν</span>)<span class="bdbLangGreek">καὶ</span> <span class="bdbLangGreek">σοί</span>; [[Matt.8.29|Matt 8:29]]; [[Mark.5.7|Mark 5:7]]; [[John.2.4|John 2:4]] and Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **e.** = ***whatsoever*** (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִי‎</span> **g**): 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***a***) [[Judg.9.48|Judg 9:48]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ראיתם עשׂיתי מהרו עשׂו כמוני מה אתם‎</span>, literally ***what*** do you see (that) I have done ? hasten, and do like me (= ***whatever*** ye see, etc.), [[2Sam.21.4|2Sam 21:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אעשׂה לכם מה אתם אמרים‎</span>, [[Job.6.24|Job 6:24]] with the apodosis introduced by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְ‎</span>, [[1Sam.20.4|1Sam 20:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה תאמר נפשׁך ואעשׂה לך‎</span>; [[Esth.5.3|Esth 5:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּקָּשָׁתֵךְ ֗֗֗ וְיִנָּתֵן לָךְ מַהֿ‎</span>, v[[Esth.5.6|Esth 5:6]]; [[Esth.7.2|Esth 7:2]]; [[Esth.9.12|Esth 9:12]] hence in the late and strange idiom of Chronicles, it sinks twice almost to the rel. ***what***, [[1Chr.15.13|1Chr 15:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כי לְמַבָּרִאשׁוֺנָה לא אתם‎</span> because ye were not (employed) for ***what*** was at first (on the former occasion), J. etc., [[2Chr.30.3|2Chr 30:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְמַדַּי‎</span> according to ***what*** was sufficient (= in sufficient numbers), compare [[Esth.9.26|Esth 9:26]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***b***) -<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהשֶּֿׁ‎</span> (late: frequently in Mishna, etc.), ***whatever, what*** (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִי אֲשֶׁר‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִי‎</span> 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **g.** ***end***): [[Eccl.1.9|Eccl 1:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהשֶּֿׁהָיָה הוּא שֶׁיִּהְיֶה‎</span>, literally ***what*** is that which hath been ? it is that which shall be (= ***whatever*** hath been, it is that which shall be), v[[Eccl.1.9|Eccl 1:9]]; [[Eccl.3.15|Eccl 3:15]]; [[Eccl.3.22|Eccl 3:22]]; [[Eccl.6.10|Eccl 6:10]]; [[Eccl.7.24|Eccl 7:24]]; [[Eccl.8.7|Eccl 8:7]]; [[Eccl.10.14|Eccl 10:14]]. 

**2.** Used adverbially: 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** as an ***interrogative:*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***a***) ***how ?*** especially in expressing what is regarded as an impossibility, [[Gen.44.16|Gen 44:16]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהנִּֿצְטַדָּ֑ק‎</span> ***how*** shall we justify ourselves ? [[Num.23.8|Num 23:8]] (twice in verse); [[1Sam.10.27|1Sam 10:27]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהיּֿשִׁעֵנוּ זֶה‎</span>, [[2Kgs.4.43|2Kgs 4:43]]; [[Job.9.2|Job 9:2]]; [[Job.25.4|Job 25:4]] (twice in verse); [[Job.31.1|Job 31:1]] I made a covenant with my eyes, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּמָה אֶתְבּוֺנֵן עַל ב‎</span> and ***how*** should I look upon a maid ? ([[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">οὐ</span>, [[BDB#Vg|ᵑ9]] ***non***), [[Prov.20.24|Prov 20:24]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דַּרְכּוֺ וְאָדָם מַהיָּֿבִין‎</span>; in an indirect question, [[Exod.10.26|Exod 10:26]]; [[Ps.39.5|Ps 39:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ֵאדְעָה מֶהחָֿדֵל אָ֑נִי‎</span>; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהזֶּֿה‎</span>, ***how, now ?*** (in surprise), [[Gen.27.20|Gen 27:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהזֶּֿה מִהַרְתָּ לִמְצאֹ בְּנִי‎</span>, [[Judg.18.24|Judg 18:24]]; [[1Kgs.21.5|1Kgs 21:5]]; [[2Kgs.1.5|2Kgs 1:5]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***b***) ***why ?*** [[Exod.14.15|Exod 14:15]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵלַי מַה תִּצְעַק‎</span>, [[Exod.17.2|Exod 17:2]] (twice in verse); [[2Kgs.6.33|2Kgs 6:33]]; [[2Kgs.7.3|2Kgs 7:3]]; [[Ps.42.6|Ps 42:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהתִּֿשְׁתּוֺחֲחִי עלי‎</span>, [[Job.15.12|Job 15:12]] +; [[Song.8.4|Song 8:4]] I adjure you <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהתָּֿעִירוּ וּמַהתְּֿעוֺרֲרוּ‎</span>, ***why*** will ye stir up, etc.? (i.e. ***do not:*** \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אִם‎</span> [[Song.2.7|Song 2:7]]; [[Song.3.5|Song 3:5]]). — The transition from the interrogative to the negative, to which in Hebrew there is an approximate (see above: especially [[1Kgs.12.16|1Kgs 12:16]]; [[Job.31.1|Job 31:1]]; [[Song.8.4|Song 8:4]]), is in Arabic complete, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> being there used constantly in the sense of ***not*** (compare Walker<sup>Hebraica. xii. 244 ff.</sup>; [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>iii, 478</sup>). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** as an ***exclamation, how ...!*** with adjectives and verbs, [[Gen.28.17|Gen 28:17]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהנּֿוֺרָא הַמָּקוֺם הַזֶּה‎</span> ***how*** dreadful is this place! [[Gen.38.29|Gen 38:29]]; [[Num.24.5|Num 24:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהטֹּֿבוּ אֹהָלֶיךָ‎</span>, [[Isa.52.7|Isa 52:7]]; [[Ps.3.2|Ps 3:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה רבו‎</span>, [[Ps.8.2|Ps 8:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה אדיר‎</span>, [[Ps.21.2|Ps 21:2]]; [[Ps.36.8|Ps 36:8]], etc., [[Song.4.10|Song 4:10]] (twice in verse); [[Song.7.2|Song 7:2]] ironically, [[2Sam.6.20|2Sam 6:20]]; [[Jer.2.33|Jer 2:33]]; [[Jer.2.36|Jer 2:36]]; [[Job.26.2|Job 26:2]]; [[Job.26.3|Job 26:3]]. 

**3.** indefinite pronoun ***anything, aught***, [[Num.23.3|Num 23:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּדְבַרמַֿהיַּֿרְאֵנִי וְהִגַּדְתִּי לָ֑ךְ‎</span> and he will shew me the matter of ***aught***, and I will tell thee (= if he shew me... I will, etc., [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>§ 149</sup>), [[1Sam.19.3|1Sam 19:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְרָאִיתִי מָה וִהִגַּדְתִּי לָ֑ךְ‎</span> = and if I see aught, I will, etc., [[1Sam.20.10|1Sam 20:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אוֺ מַהיַּֿעַנִךָ אָבִיךָ קָשָׁה‎</span> if perchance thy father shall answer thee ***aught*** that is harsh (order, **1 a** ***a***), [[2Sam.18.22|2Sam 18:22]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וִיהִימָֿה אָרוּצָהנָּֿא‎</span> but let there happen ***what may*** (literally ***aught***), I will run, v[[2Sam.18.23|2Sam 18:23]] (compare [[Job.13.13|Job 13:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְיַעֲבֹר עָלַי מָה‎</span>), v[[Job.13.29|Job 13:29]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְלֹא יָדַעְתִּי מָה‎</span> (compare [[Prov.9.13|Prov 9:13]]), [[Prov.25.8|Prov 25:8]]. compare [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>iii. § 65.</sup> 

**4.** With prepositions: 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּמָּה‎</span><sub>9</sub>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּמֶּה‎</span><sub>19</sub> ***wherein ?*** [[Exod.22.26|Exod 22:26]]; [[Judg.16.5|Judg 16:5]]; [[1Sam.14.38|1Sam 14:38]] (indirect question; [[BDB#We|We]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּמִי‎</span>); and so according to the various senses of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span>: ***whereby ?*** [[Gen.15.8|Gen 15:8]]; [[Exod.33.16|Exod 33:16]]; [[Mal.1.2|Mal 1:2]]; [[Mal.1.6|Mal 1:6]]; [[Mal.1.7|Mal 1:7]]; [[Mal.2.17|Mal 2:17]]; <ref ref="Mal 3:7-8" b="39" cBegin="3" vBegin="7" cEnd="3" vEnd="8" onclick="bcv(39,3,7)">Mal 3:7-8</ref> ***wherewith ?*** [[1Sam.6.2|1Sam 6:2]]; [[2Sam.21.3|2Sam 21:3]]; [[Mic.6.6|Mic 6:6]] ***by what means ?*** [[Judg.16.5|Judg 16:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּבַמֶּה נוּכַל לוֺ‎</span>; ***at what*** (worth) ? [[Isa.2.22|Isa 2:22]] ***for what ?*** [[2Chr.7.21|2Chr 7:21]] (\|\| [[1Kgs.9.8|1Kgs 9:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עלמֿה‎</span>). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַעַן מֶה‎</span> [[Hag.1.9|Hag 1:9]] ***because of what ?*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּמָּה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּמֶּה‎</span>, properly ***the like of what ?*** (Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">); hence 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***a***) ***how much ? how many ?*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּמָּה יְמֵי וגו‎</span> [[Gen.47.8|Gen 47:8]]; [[2Sam.19.35|2Sam 19:35]]; [[Ps.119.84|Ps 119:84]]; [[Job.13.23|Job 13:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַד כַּמֶּה פְעָמִים‎</span> [[1Kgs.22.16|1Kgs 22:16]] (= [[2Chr.18.15|2Chr 18:15]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּמָּה‎</span> ***how often ?*** [[Job.21.17|Job 21:17]] (i.e. how seldom !); in an indirect question, ***how much ?*** [[Zech.2.6|Zech 2:6]] (twice in verse). As an exclamation, [[Zech.7.3|Zech 7:3]] as I have done <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה כַמֶּה שָׁנִים‎</span> now (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה‎</span> **4 i**), ***how many*** years ! [[Ps.78.40|Ps 78:40]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּמָּה‎</span> ***how often !*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***b***) ***for how long ?*** [[Ps.35.17|Ps 35:17]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כמה תראה‎</span>, [[Job.7.19|Job 7:19]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָ֫מָּה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָמָ֫ה‎</span> (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָמָ֫ה‎</span> mostly before the gutturals <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎א‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ע‎</span> and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> [i.e. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲדֹנָי‎</span>], but twice besides, [[Ps.42.10|Ps 42:10]]; [[Ps.43.2|Ps 43:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָ֫מָּה‎</span> also occurs before guttural, in five places noted by Masoretes on [[Ps.43.2|Ps 43:2]], namely [[1Sam.28.15|1Sam 28:15]]; [[2Sam.2.22|2Sam 2:22]]; [[2Sam.14.31|2Sam 14:31]]; [[Ps.49.6|Ps 49:6]]; [[Jer.15.18|Jer 15:18]], and before <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ךְ‎</span> [[Gen.4.6|Gen 4:6]]; [[2Sam.14.13|2Sam 14:13]]; [[2Sam.24.3|2Sam 24:3]]; [[Eccl.2.15|Eccl 2:15]]), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָ֫מָה‎</span> [[Job.7.20|Job 7:20]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָ֫מֶה‎</span> [[1Sam.1.8|1Sam 1:8]] (3 t. in verse), ***for what reason ? why?*** [[Gen.4.6|Gen 4:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎למה חרה לך‎</span> ***why*** art thou angry ? [[Gen.24.31|Gen 24:31]], etc.; often strengthened by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה‎</span> (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶה‎</span> **4 e**), [[Gen.18.13|Gen 18:13]]; [[Gen.32.30|Gen 32:30]] (= [[Judg.13.18|Judg 13:18]]) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎למה זה תשׁאל לשׁמי‎</span>, [[Judg.33.15|Judg 33:15]]; [[Exod.2.20|Exod 2:20]]; [[Exod.5.22|Exod 5:22]]; [[Exod.17.3|Exod 17:3]], etc., [[Jer.6.20|Jer 6:20]]; [[Jer.20.18|Jer 20:18]] +; [[Gen.25.22|Gen 25:22]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זה אנכי אם כן למהֿ‎</span> if so, ***why, then***, am I ? (why do I continue to live ?); = ***to what purpose*** (followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִ‎</span> person), [[Gen.27.46|Gen 27:46]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎למה לי חיים‎</span>, [[Isa.1.11|Isa 1:11]]; [[Jer.6.20|Jer 6:20]]; [[Amos.5.18|Amos 5:18]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎למה זה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לכם יום י‎</span>, [[Job.30.2|Job 30:2]] in an indirect question, [[1Sam.6.3|1Sam 6:3]]; [[Dan.10.20|Dan 10:20]]. Note especially 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***a***) in expostulations, [[Gen.12.18|Gen 12:18]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎למה לא הגדת לי‎</span> ***why*** didst thou not tell me, etc. ? v[[Gen.12.19|Gen 12:19]]; [[Gen.29.25|Gen 29:25]]; [[Gen.31.27|Gen 31:27]]; [[Gen.42.1|Gen 42:1]]; [[Gen.43.6|Gen 43:6]]; [[1Sam.21.15|1Sam 21:15]]; [[1Sam.22.13|1Sam 22:13]]; [[1Sam.24.10|1Sam 24:10]]; [[Ps.22.2|Ps 22:2]]; [[Ps.44.24|Ps 44:24]]; [[Ps.44.25|Ps 44:25]]; [[Ps.74.1|Ps 74:1]]; [[Ps.74.11|Ps 74:11]] + often; 
$\quad$ $\quad$ $\quad$ (***b***) with an imperfect, often deprecating, or introducing rhetorically, the reason why something should, or should not, be done, ***why should . . .?*** [[1Sam.19.5|1Sam 19:5]]; [[1Sam.19.17|1Sam 19:17]]; [[1Sam.20.8|1Sam 20:8]] but to thy father (emphatic) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎למה זה תביאני‎</span>, ***why shouldst*** thou bring me ? [[1Sam.20.32|1Sam 20:32]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מה עשׂה למה יומת‎</span> ***why should*** he be put to death ? [[2Sam.13.26|2Sam 13:26]]; [[2Sam.16.9|2Sam 16:9]]; [[2Sam.20.19|2Sam 20:19]]; [[2Kgs.14.10|2Kgs 14:10]], etc.: in such cases, it approximates in meaning to ***lest*** (compare Phoenician [[BDB#CIS|CIS]]<sup>i. 2, 21</sup> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יסגרינם אלנם לָםָ‎</span> ***ne*** tradant eos dii), and is in [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] often rendered by <span class="bdbLangGreek">μήποτε</span>, as [[Gen.27.45|Gen 27:45]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎למה אשׁכל‎</span> ***why should*** I be bereaved, etc. ? [[Exod.32.12|Exod 32:12]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יאמרו מצרים למה‎</span> [[Neh.6.3|Neh 6:3]]; [[Ps.79.10|Ps 79:10]]; [[Ps.115.2|Ps 115:2]]; [[Eccl.7.16|Eccl 7:16]], <span class="bdbLangGreek">μή</span>, [[Jer.40.15|Jer 40:15]], <span class="bdbLangGreek">ἵνα μή</span>, [[Gen.47.19|Gen 47:19]]; [[2Sam.2.22|2Sam 2:22]]; [[2Chr.25.16|2Chr 25:16]]; [[Eccl.5.5|Eccl 5:5]]; [[Eccl.7.17|Eccl 7:17]], or <span class="bdbLangGreek">ὅπως μή</span>, [[Joel.2.17|Joel 2:17]] (in [[1Sam.19.17|1Sam 19:17]]; [[2Sam.13.26|2Sam 13:26]], paraph. by <span class="bdbLangGreek">εἰ μή</span>); and, connected with the foregoing sentence by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אשׁר‎</span>, or <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֶׁ‎</span>, in late, or dialect., Hebrew it actually has that meaning, [[Dan.1.10|Dan 1:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲשֶׁר לָמָּה יִרְאֶה‎</span> ***lest*** he see, [[Song.1.7|Song 1:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שַׁלָּמָ֫ה אֶהְיֶה‎</span> ***lest*** I become (so in Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לְמָה דִּי‎</span> [[Ezra.7.23|Ezra 7:23]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דִּילְמָא‎</span> [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]], Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, both regularly = ***lest***). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **e.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַדמָֿה‎</span> ([[Ps.4.3|Ps 4:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַדמֶֿה‎</span>) ***until when ? how long ?*** [[Num.24.22|Num 24:22]] (aposiop.), [[Ps.4.3|Ps 4:3]]; [[Ps.79.5|Ps 79:5]]; [[Ps.89.47|Ps 89:47]] in indirect question, [[Ps.74.9|Ps 74:9]] (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד אנה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עד מתי‎</span>). **feminine** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלמָֿה‎</span>, and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלמֶֿה‎</span>, ***upon what ?*** [[Job.38.6|Job 38:6]]; [[2Chr.32.10|2Chr 32:10]] ***upon what ground ? wherefore ?*** [[Num.22.32|Num 22:32]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלמָֿה הִכִּיתָ אֶתאֲֿתֹנְךָ‎</span>, [[Deut.29.23|Deut 29:23]] (compare [[1Kgs.9.8|1Kgs 9:8]]; [[Jer.22.8|Jer 22:8]]), [[Isa.1.5|Isa 1:5]]; [[Jer.8.14|Jer 8:14]]; [[Jer.9.11|Jer 9:11]]; [[Jer.16.10|Jer 16:10]]; [[Ezek.21.12|Ezek 21:12]]; [[Ps.10.13|Ps 10:13]]; [[Job.13.14|Job 13:14]] (probably dittograph from v[[Job.13.13|Job 13:13]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עלמֿהזֿה‎</span> [[Neh.2.4|Neh 2:4]]. In an indirect question, [[Job.10.2|Job 10:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הוֺדִיעֻנִי עַל מַהתְּֿרִיבֻנִי‎</span>, [[Esth.4.5|Esth 4:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָדַעַת מַהזֶּֿה וְעַלמַֿהוֶּֿה‎</span>.
